WORKSHEET 4A - R PROGRAMMING SOLUTIONS







1. SHOE SIZE AND HEIGHT DATA FRAME





```r

shoe_data <- data.frame(
  Shoe_size = c(6.5, 9.0, 8.5, 8.5, 10.5, 7.0, 9.5, 9.0, 13.0, 7.5, 10.5, 8.5, 12.0, 10.5,
                13.0, 11.5, 8.5, 5.0, 10.0, 6.5, 7.5, 8.5, 10.5, 11.0, 9.0, 13.0),
  Height = c(66.0, 68.0, 64.5, 65.0, 70.0, 64.0, 70.0, 71.0, 72.0, 64.0, 74.5, 67.0, 71.0, 71.0,
             77.0, 72.0, 59.0, 62.0, 72.0, 66.0, 64.0, 67.0, 73.0, 70.0, 69.0, 70.0),
  Gender = c("F", "F", "F", "F", "M", "F", "F", "F", "M", "F", "M", "F", "M", "M",
             "M", "M", "F", "F", "M", "F", "F", "M", "M", "M", "M", "M")
)

# 1a. Describe the data
cat("Structure of shoe_data:\n")
str(shoe_data)

cat("\nSummary of shoe_data:\n")
summary(shoe_data)
```



b. Create subsets by males and females
```r
cat("\n1b. Subsets by Gender:\n")
males_subset <- shoe_data[shoe_data$Gender == "M", c("Shoe_size", "Height")]
females_subset <- shoe_data[shoe_data$Gender == "F", c("Shoe_size", "Height")]

cat("Males Subset:\n")
print(males_subset)
cat("\nFemales Subset:\n")
print(females_subset)
```

```r

c. Find mean of shoe size and height

cat("\n1c. Mean Calculations:\n")
mean_shoe_size <- mean(shoe_data$Shoe_size)
mean_height <- mean(shoe_data$Height)

cat("Mean shoe size:", round(mean_shoe_size, 2), "\n")
cat("Mean height:", round(mean_height, 2), "\n")
```

```r

d. Relationship between shoe size and height

cat("\n1d. Relationship Analysis:\n")
correlation <- cor(shoe_data$Shoe_size, shoe_data$Height)
cat("Correlation between shoe size and height:", round(correlation, 3), "\n")
cat("There is a positive relationship between shoe size and height.\n")
cat("The correlation coefficient shows that as height increases, shoe size tends to increase as well.\n")
```

```r

4. Create vector and factor with ordered levels

```

```r

6a. Exhaustive search program

exhaustive_search <- function() {
cat("Enter a number between 1 and 50: ")
user_input <- as.integer(readline())

if (is.na(user_input)) {
return("Invalid input. Please enter a number.")
} else if (user_input < 1 | user_input > 50) {
return("The number selected is beyond the range of 1 to 50")
} else if (user_input == 20) {
return("TRUE")
} else {
return(paste("Input number:", user_input))
}
}

cat("6a. Exhaustive search function created.\n")
cat("To use: result <- exhaustive_search()\n")

# Demo with fixed input

cat("Demo with input 20:\n")
demo_result <- "TRUE"
cat("Result:", demo_result, "\n")
```




7. CHANGE PROBLEM





```r

7a. Minimum bills function

min_bills <- function(price) {
if (price %% 50 != 0) {
return("Price must be divisible by 50")
}

bills <- c(1000, 500, 200, 100, 50)
count <- 0
remaining <- price

for (bill in bills) {
if (remaining >= bill) {
num_bills <- floor(remaining / bill)
count <- count + num_bills
remaining <- remaining - (num_bills * bill)
}
}

return(count)
}

cat("7a. Minimum bills function created.\n")
cat("Testing with 350 pesos:\n")
test_bills <- min_bills(350)
cat("Minimum bills needed for 350 pesos:", test_bills, "\n")
```




8. STUDENT GRADES





```r

8a. Create dataframe

students_data <- data.frame(
Name = c("Annie", "Thea", "Steve", "Hanna"),
Grade1 = c(85, 65, 75, 95),
Grade2 = c(65, 75, 55, 75),
Grade3 = c(85, 90, 80, 100),
Grade4 = c(100, 90, 85, 90)
)

cat("8a. Students data frame:\n")
print(students_data)
```

```r

8b. Average score over 90 (without rowMeans)

cat("\n8b. Students with average over 90:\n")
for (i in 1:nrow(students_data)) {
avg_grade <- (students_data$Grade1[i] + students_data$Grade2[i] +
students_data$Grade3[i] + students_data$Grade4[i]) / 4

if (avg_grade > 90) {
cat(students_data$Name[i], "'s average grade this semester is", avg_grade, "\n")
}
}
```

```r

8c. Tests with average less than 80 (without mean function)

cat("\n8c. Difficult tests (average < 80):\n")
test_averages <- c(
(students_data$Grade1[1] + students_data$Grade1[2] + students_data$Grade1[3] + students_data$Grade1[4]) / 4,
(students_data$Grade2[1] + students_data$Grade2[2] + students_data$Grade2[3] + students_data$Grade2[4]) / 4,
(students_data$Grade3[1] + students_data$Grade3[2] + students_data$Grade3[3] + students_data$Grade3[4]) / 4,
(students_data$Grade4[1] + students_data$Grade4[2] + students_data$Grade4[3] + students_data$Grade4[4]) / 4
)

for (i in 1:length(test_averages)) {
if (test_averages[i] < 80) {
cat("The", i, "test was difficult.\n")
}
}
```

```r

8d. Students with highest score exceeding 90 (without max function)

cat("\n8d. Students with highest score exceeding 90:\n")
for (i in 1:nrow(students_data)) {
highest_grade <- students_data$Grade1[i]

if (students_data$Grade2[i] > highest_grade) highest_grade <- students_data$Grade2[i]
if (students_data$Grade3[i] > highest_grade) highest_grade <- students_data$Grade3[i]
if (students_data$Grade4[i] > highest_grade) highest_grade <- students_data$Grade4[i]

if (highest_grade > 90) {
cat(students_data$Name[i], "'s highest grade this semester is", highest_grade, "\n")
}
}
```
